titleStmt.title: The true lover's paradice. Cupid with his golden dart! Pierc'd this youngster in the heart; he counts love a pleasant pain, and his freedom doth disdain. Let other lovers pattern take by him who'll dye for Celia's sake. To an excellent new play-house tune: or, Oh how pleasant are the charms of love.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Conyers at the Black Raven in Holborn.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "Ah! how pleasant are the charms of love ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
